name: anatomize
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to examine and describe something in detail: In his book, he anatomizes the scientific and political debate over global warming. The deeper meanings of his work are not fully anatomized here.
to cut something open, especially a dead body, in order to examine its structure: His plea was rejected and he was sentenced to be hanged and then anatomized. Synonym
dissect
More examplesFewer examplesHer marriage, her hair, her clothes, her voice and her laugh have been more minutely anatomized than her voting record. The novel anatomizes America with insight, passion and inventiveness.After anatomizing the different types of reading, he addresses the social implications.He has produced many plays anatomizing the forms of existential loneliness.In this masterwork, shot in highly atmospheric scenes, Antonioni anatomized the increasing materialism and angst of the early 1960s.The first thing for a new user after installing any application is usually to customize it, not to dissect and anatomize its deepest innards.
